 213:     # Create the OpenCL kernel
+214:     kernel = """
  __Pyx_INCREF(__pyx_kp_u_kernel_void_outer_loop___glob);
  __pyx_v_kernel = __pyx_kp_u_kernel_void_outer_loop___glob;

 215:         __kernel void outer_loop(__global double* randoms, __global double* sim_array, float lp, int num_days, int num_sim) {
 216:             int y = get_global_id(0);
 217:             for(int x = 0; x < num_days - 1; x++) {
 218:                 if (x == 0) {
 219:                     sim_array[y*(num_days-1) + x] = lp * (1 + randoms[y * num_days + x]);
 220:                 } else {
 221:                     sim_array[y*(num_days-1) + x] = sim_array[y*(num_days-1) + (x-1)] * (1 + randoms[y * num_days + x]);
 222:                 }
 223:             }
 224:         }
 225:     """

 241: # def generate_randoms(num_sim, num_days, vola, timestamps, randoms):
 242: #     # Create OpenCL context and command queue
 243: #     ctx = cl.create_some_context()
 244: #     queue = cl.CommandQueue(ctx)
 245: 
 246: #     # Create input and output buffers
 247: #     timestamps_buf = cl.Buffer(ctx, cl.mem_flags.READ_ONLY | cl.mem_flags.COPY_HOST_PTR, hostbuf=timestamps)
 248: #     randoms_buf = cl.Buffer(ctx, cl.mem_flags.WRITE_ONLY, randoms.nbytes)
 249: 
 250: #     # Create kernel
 251: #     kernel = """
 252: #          __kernel void random_numbers(__global ulong *timestamps, __global float *randoms, float vola) {
 253: #             int gid = get_global_id(0);
 254: #             double pi = 3.14159265358979323846;
 255: #             unsigned int seed = (unsigned int)timestamps[gid];
 256: #             float4 rand = intel_printf(&seed);
 257: #             randoms[gid] = vola * sqrt(-2.0 * log(dot(rand, (float4)(1.0f,0.0f,0.0f,0.0f))) ) * cos(2 * pi * dot(rand, (float4)(1.0f,0.0f,0.0f,0.0f)));
 258: #         }
 259: #     """
 260: 
 261: #     # Compile kernel
 262: #     prg = cl.Program(ctx, kernel).build()
 263: 
 264: #     # Execute kernel
 265: #     global_size = (num_sim*num_days,)
 266: #     local_size = None
 267: 
 268: #     prg.random_numbers(queue, global_size, local_size, timestamps_buf, randoms_buf)
 269: 
 270: #     # Read result
 271: #     cl.enqueue_copy(queue, randoms, randoms_buf)
 272: #     return randoms
